meanings.sent1: The lion was siring cubs in the wild.
meanings.sent2: The stallion was siring many foals on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The dog thought he was siring a whole pack of puppies!
meanings.sent4: The oak tree siring new branches every spring.
meanings.sent5: The king was siring heirs to the throne.

meanings.sent1: Siring is essential for the continuation of species.
meanings.sent2: The mare's siring resulted in a beautiful foal.
meanings.sent3: The zoo celebrated the successful siring of a baby elephant.
meanings.sent4: The siring of new ideas is crucial for progress.
meanings.sent5: The miracle of siring never ceases to amaze.

meanings.definition: The male parent of an animal or plant
meanings.sent1: The stallion proudly stood as the siring of the herd.
meanings.sent2: The lion's majestic mane identified him as the siring of the pride.
meanings.sent3: The oak tree was considered the siring of the forest.
meanings.sent4: The farmer admired the rooster as the siring of the chickens.
meanings.sent5: The dog wagged his tail happily, knowing he was the siring of the litter.
